info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 16 at 6:51PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR LIGHT ICING OF ROADWAYS AND REDUCED VISIBILITIES THIS EVENING... WEATHER... * Temperatures ranging between 24 and 32 degrees will continue to fall this evening causing residual moisture to freeze on roadways in addition to areas of freezing rain moving through. * Snow accumulations of a half to one inch are expected overnight after freezing rain fully changes over to snow by 10 PM. * Northeast winds around 15 mph with gusts to 25 mph. IMPACTS... * The freezing of residual moisture on roadways and the arrival of freezing rain showers will result in icy conditions, particularly on bridges, exit ramps, and overpasses. * Reductions of visibility to less than one mile are also possible once freezing rain changes over to snow. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Black ice conditions are particularly dangerous with the ice often invisible or difficult to discern from wet pavement. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for variable driving conditions by slowing down and allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
